title: 'Harbingers of doom': Anchor lashes out at meteorologist over heat wave reporting
description: CNN's Jim Acosta reports on a tense interaction between a British meteorologist and anchor over the deadly UK heat wave, which Acosta likens to a scene from Netflix's "Don't Look Up."

title: Columnist says she regrets calling on Franken to resign. Hear his response
description: Former Sen. Al Franken tells CNN's Jim Acosta what he thinks of The New York Times columnist Michelle Goldberg's piece saying she was wrong to call on Franken to resign without a proper investigation into allegations of sexual harassment.

title: Murdoch's New York Post dumps Trump, calling him 'unworthy'
description: One of Donald Trump's favorite newspapers — controlled by his media ally Rupert Murdoch — says Trump is "unworthy to be this country's chief executive again."

title: An independent Russian news network given a new lease of life
description: Tikhon Dzyadko, Editor-in-Chief of Russian independent news channel TV Rain, discusses the network's relaunch from abroad after being forced out of Russia over its coverage of the war in Ukraine.

title: Kyiv and Moscow agree deal to resume Ukraine grain exports
description: Ukraine and Russia have agreed a deal that would allow the resumption of vital grain exports from Ukrainian Black Sea ports, a major diplomatic breakthrough aimed at easing a global food crisis sparked by the war.

title: Hear what former Secret Service agent blames for missing Jan. 6 text messages
description: Former Secret Service agent Jonathan Wackrow believes the now missing text messages sent by Secret Service personnel on January 6 are a result of "sloppy governance" rather than a criminal cover-up.

title: Brexit blamed for delays as British truckers and travelers face gridlock at Dover
description: Brexit has contributed to travelers being stuck in gridlock at the start of the summer holidays at the port of Dover, French and UK officials have said, as a war of words escalates between the two countries over hours-long delays at the border.

title: Thousands join Budapest Pride march in sweltering heat
description: In sweltering temperatures, thousands of Hungarians took part in the annual Budapest Pride march on Saturday, vowing to keep up their fight against government policies on LGBTQ rights that have drawn EU condemnation.

title: The surprisingly simple technique that can turn deserts green
description: When I was training to be a journalist, the best piece of advice I got was KISS-- keep it simple, stupid.

title: WHO declares monkeypox a public health emergency of international concern
description: The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared the monkeypox outbreak a public health emergency of international concern.

title: Two Americans killed in Ukraine's Donbas region
description: Two American citizens recently died in the Donbas region of Ukraine, the State Department confirmed Saturday.

title: Blistering heat threatens a European economy that teeters on the brink
description: Carsten Brzeski, a top economist at the Dutch Bank ING, can tick off a long list of factors that could collectively tip Europe's economy into a recession.

title: Ryan Gosling brings the heat in spy thriller 'The Gray Man'
description: I was going to make a joke about how hot it is out and how hot the stars are in the first of the three things to watch this week, but I'm too busy sweating to amuse you all.

title: Why everyone's wearing NASA-branded clothes
description: On any given day, a thirty minute walk around New York City can yield at least a few NASA logo sightings. They're on backpacks, t-shirts, sneakers, hats, sweatshirts, phone cases, tote bags and jackets.

title: Sydney McLaughlin breaks her own 400-meter hurdles world record
description: American runner Sydney McLaughlin broke her own 400-meter hurdles world record to take gold on Friday night at the World Athletics Championships in Eugene, Oregon.

title: As Biden ponders 2024, here's why some presidents quit
description: That a sitting president, even one approaching 80, would commit to seeking another four-year term seems like a foregone conclusion today.

title: 1 killed and several injured in shooting in downtown Renton, Washington, police say
description: At least one person was killed and five others were injured in a shooting in downtown Renton, Washington, early Saturday morning, police said.

title: Women's Euro 2022: Sweden triumphs over Belgium 1-0 with feverish late injury-time winner
description: Sweden beat Belgium 1-0 at the Leigh Sports Village stadium near Manchester on Friday night, after veteran Linda Sembrant mustered a late winner in injury time to secure her side's spot in the Women's Euro 2022 semifinals.

title: Oppressive heat will bake much of the US this weekend
description: Relentless, oppressive heat will grip much of the US this weekend, with the Northeast region expected to bear the brunt amid forecasts for near-record temperatures across the region.

title: How to have fun this summer in spite of Covid-19 and extreme heat
description: It really is a cruel summer.

title: Say goodbye to your favorite Italian beach break
description: It's the Italian dream: sprawling on one of the Mediterranean's best beaches, drink in hand, moving only to eat some freshly caught fish or pick up another glass of local wine.

title: Scandinavia and South America capture world's top restaurant awards
description: This week in travel news: the world's best restaurants for 2022, the world's most powerful passports and the worst airports for delays and cancellations this summer.

title: Disney changes name of 'fairy godmothers' in US theme parks to gender-neutral term
description: Disney's "fairy godmothers" who dress up children as princesses and knights at its US theme parks are now called "apprentices," a gender-neutral term which is part of its efforts to be more inclusive, the company said on Friday.

title: Steve Bannon found guilty of contempt for defying Jan. 6 committee subpoena
This mushroom-shaped ring broke the world record for most diamonds in a single ring
description: If just one diamond isn't enough, SWA Diamonds might have the perfect ring for you.

title: FBI investigation found Chinese-made equipment posed surveillance risk
description: On paper, it looked like a fantastic deal. In 2017, the Chinese government was offering to spend $100 million to build an ornate Chinese garden at the National Arboretum in Washington DC. Complete with temples, pavilions and a 70-foot white pagoda, the project thrilled local officials, who hoped it would attract thousands of tourists every year.

title: Analysis: UK's ruling party loses hope
description: • Analysis: Two vie to replace Boris Johnson. Neither has 'a true plan' to fix its ailing economy

title: Myanmar genocide case over Rohingya atrocities can go ahead, top UN court rules
description: The World Court on Friday rejected Myanmar's objections to a genocide case over its treatment of the Muslim Rohingya minority, paving the way for the case to be heard in full.

title: How Koreans fell in love with an American World War II era personality test
description: It's as if Seoul is infatuated. Stroll through the South Korean capital and amid the sea of traditional Hangul characters it's hard not to notice the same four letters of the Latin alphabet cropping up again and again: MBTI.
